com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.spi

Interface QueryPathService


  • public interface QueryPathService
    Service responsible for dealing with path query related features of Data Persistence Service.

    • Method Detail

      • getTargetObjects

        <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> getTargetObjects(java.lang.String bucketName,
                                           com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.graph.QueryPath queryPath)
        Executes the query and gets the result as an iterable of 'full' objects queried for. Will always return the full object from the database.

        The resultant execution can not guarantee the order, unless the query itself defines it (e.g. is ordered in any way). Two executions of this method with the same unordered query can produce two iterators with different order of objects.

        Note that it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that a target with a valid alias has been set on the target of the query - if no explicit target is defined the last component in the path will be the target and an implied alias will be applied by DPS.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects returned by the execution of the query. It is the responsibility of the users of this method to do the right type casting, according to the type of query executed
        Parameters:
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        queryPath - query to be executed
        Returns:
        an iterable of objects queried for.

      • projectResults

        java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> projectResults(java.lang.String bucketName,
                                                                                    com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.graph.QueryPath queryPath,
                                                                                    com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.graph.ProjectionOptions projectionOptions,
                                                                                    com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.graph.PathProjection... pathProjections)
        Project the results from points in the query path. Projections allow the user project single data elements from the objects which were found along a query path - these elements can be modelled (i.e. persistence object attributes) or non-modelled (i.e. object fields).

        Note that query path projections do not retain the exact type of the data for numeric types. For example an attribute modelled as an integer may not be returned as an Integer. It is likely the returned type will be a Long but to be safe it is best to assume it is a Number.

        Elements of type Date are always returned as the Long representing the result of Date.getTime().

        The projections are returned an an Iterable of maps, where the keys of the map are the aliases of the supplied projections.

        Parameters:
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        queryPath - query to be executed.
        projectionOptions - the projection options to apply.
        pathProjections - the projections to apply to the query.
        Returns:
        an iterable of maps, where the keys in the map are the projection aliases.
        See Also:
        PathProjection.getProjectionAlias()
